content: वृषः {@--1@} A bull; असंपदस्तस्य वृषेण गच्छतः <ls>Ku. 5. 80</ls>; <ls>Me. 52</ls>; <ls>R. 2. 35</ls>; <ls>Ms. 9. 123.</ls> {@--2@} The sign {%Taurus%} of the zodiac. {@--3@} The chief or best of a class, the best of its kind; <ls>Ms. 3. 18</ls>; (often at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>); मुनिवृषः, कपिवृषः &c. {@--4@} The god of love. {@--5@} A strong or athletic man. {@--6@} A lustful man, a man of one of the four classes into which men are divided in erotic works; see <ls>Ratimañjarī 37.</ls> {@--7@} An enemy, adversary. {@--8@} A rat. {@--9@} The bull of Śiva. {@--10@} Morality, justice. {@--11@} Virtue, a pious or meritorious act; न सद्गतिः स्याद् वृषवर्जितानां <ls>Kīr. K. 9. 62</ls> (where वृष means a ‘bull’ also). {@--12@} <ab>N.</ab> of Karṇa. {@--13@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. {@--14@} <ab>N.</ab> of a particular drug. {@--15@} The principal die. --षं A peacock's plumage.
